page.title: 16OFFA'S DYKE
page.content: The Dyke was built by King Offa's men because the Welsh kept on taking the cows and sheep.The Dyke is 80 miles long from Prestattyn to Chepstow,but the footpath is 160 miles long.Alot of people walk the part of the Dyke which is in the Selattyn area.The Dyke is a pretty place to walk because there is quite alot of wildlife to be seen. Such as rabbits,foxes and badgers.The Dyke is about 12feet but in some places it is 20feet.About 300 people walk the whole dyke each year. The trees at the higher points are mostly conifers. Few houses can be seen from theDyke,but quite alot of farms & farm buildings. From the Dyke all you can see are rivers,fern and grassland.The Dyke is a steep bank with a ditch on one side. Now the Dyke is grass covered and sheep graze on the bank.
